Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'controlIconsEnabled' must be true or false. Default is false.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'zoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'dblClickZoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'mouseWheelZoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'preventMouseEventsDefault' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'zoomScaleSensitivity' must be a scalar. Default is 0.2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'minZoom' must be a scalar. Default is 0.5.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'maxZoom' must be a scalar. Default is 10.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'fit' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'contain' must be true or false. Default is false.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'center' must be true or false. Default is true.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'refreshRate' must be a number or 'auto'\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'beforeZoom' must be a callback function to be called before zoom changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'onZoom' must be a callback function to be called when zoom changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'beforePan' must be a callback function to be called before pan changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'onPan' must be a callback function to be called when pan changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'customEventsHandler' must be an object with \u003ccode\u003einit\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edestroy\u003c/code\u003e arguments as functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e'eventsListenerElement' must be an SVGElement or null.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ebeforeZoom\u003c/code\u003e will be called with 2 float attributes: oldZoom and newZoom.\nIf \u003ccode\u003ebeforeZoom\u003c/code\u003e will return \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e then zooming will be halted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eonZoom\u003c/code\u003e callbacks will be called with one float attribute representing new zoom scale.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ebeforePan\u003c/code\u003e will be called with 2 attributes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eoldPan\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003enewPan\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach of these objects has two attributes (x and y) representing current pan (on X and Y axes).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf \u003ccode\u003ebeforePan\u003c/code\u003e will return \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e or an object \u003ccode\u003e{x: true, y: true}\u003c/code\u003e then panning will be halted.\nIf you want to prevent panning only on one axis then return an object of type \u003ccode\u003e{x: true, y: false}\u003c/code\u003e.\nYou can alter panning on X and Y axes by providing alternative values through return \u003ccode\u003e{x: 10, y: 20}\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eCaution!\u003c/em\u003e If you alter panning by returning custom values \u003ccode\u003e{x: 10, y: 20}\u003c/code\u003e it will update only current pan step. If panning is done by mouse/touch you have to take in account that next pan step (after the one that you altered) will be performed with values that do not consider altered values (as they even did not existed).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eonPan\u003c/code\u003e callback will be called with one attribute: \u003ccode\u003enewPan\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eCaution!\u003c/em\u003e Calling zoom or pan API methods from inside of \u003ccode\u003ebeforeZoom\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eonZoom\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ebeforePan\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eonPan\u003c/code\u003e callbacks may lead to infinite loop.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eonUpdatedCTM\u003c/code\u003e will get called after the CTM will get updated. That happens asynchronously from pan and zoom events.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003epanEnabled\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ezoomEnabled\u003c/code\u003e are related only to user interaction. If any of this options are disabled - you still can zoom and pan via API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003efit\u003c/code\u003e takes precedence over \u003ccode\u003econtain\u003c/code\u003e. So if you set \u003ccode\u003efit: true\u003c/code\u003e then \u003ccode\u003econtain\u003c/code\u003e's value doesn't matter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" graphical element of type SVGGElement (\u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;g\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSVGGElement has no \u003ccode\u003etransform\u003c/code\u003e attribute\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThere is no other SVGGElement with class name \u003ccode\u003esvg-pan-zoom_viewport\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp class=\"svg-pan-zoom_viewport\"\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/g\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDo not set any \u003cem\u003etransform\u003c/em\u003e It adds events listeners for mouse scroll, double-click and pan, plus it optionally offers:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>JavaScript API for control of pan and zoom behavior</li><li>onPan and onZoom event handlers</li><li>On-screen zoom controls</li></ul><p dir="auto">It works cross-browser and supports both inline SVGs and SVGs in HTML <code>object</code> or <code>embed</code> elements.</p><blockquote><p dir="auto">If you're looking for version 2.3.x you can find it in <a href="https://github.com/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/tree/v2.3.x">v2.3.x branch</a></p></blockquote><div class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">If any arguments are specified, they must have the following value types:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>'viewportSelector' can be querySelector string or SVGElement.</li><li>'panEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'controlIconsEnabled' must be true or false. Default is false.</li><li>'zoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'dblClickZoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'mouseWheelZoomEnabled' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'preventMouseEventsDefault' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'zoomScaleSensitivity' must be a scalar. Default is 0.2.</li><li>'minZoom' must be a scalar. Default is 0.5.</li><li>'maxZoom' must be a scalar. Default is 10.</li><li>'fit' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'contain' must be true or false. Default is false.</li><li>'center' must be true or false. Default is true.</li><li>'refreshRate' must be a number or 'auto'</li><li>'beforeZoom' must be a callback function to be called before zoom changes.</li><li>'onZoom' must be a callback function to be called when zoom changes.</li><li>'beforePan' must be a callback function to be called before pan changes.</li><li>'onPan' must be a callback function to be called when pan changes.</li><li>'customEventsHandler' must be an object with <code>init</code> and <code>destroy</code> arguments as functions.</li><li>'eventsListenerElement' must be an SVGElement or null.</li></ul><p dir="auto"><code>beforeZoom</code> will be called with 2 float attributes: oldZoom and newZoom.If <code>beforeZoom</code> will return <code>false</code> then zooming will be halted.</p><p dir="auto"><code>onZoom</code> callbacks will be called with one float attribute representing new zoom scale.</p><p dir="auto"><code>beforePan</code> will be called with 2 attributes:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>oldPan</code></li><li><code>newPan</code></li></ul><p dir="auto">Each of these objects has two attributes (x and y) representing current pan (on X and Y axes).</p><p dir="auto">If <code>beforePan</code> will return <code>false</code> or an object <code>{x: true, y: true}</code> then panning will be halted.If you want to prevent panning only on one axis then return an object of type <code>{x: true, y: false}</code>.You can alter panning on X and Y axes by providing alternative values through return <code>{x: 10, y: 20}</code>.</p><blockquote><p dir="auto"><em>Caution!</em> If you alter panning by returning custom values <code>{x: 10, y: 20}</code> it will update only current pan step. If panning is done by mouse/touch you have to take in account that next pan step (after the one that you altered) will be performed with values that do not consider altered values (as they even did not existed).</p></blockquote><p dir="auto"><code>onPan</code> callback will be called with one attribute: <code>newPan</code>.</p><blockquote><p dir="auto"><em>Caution!</em> Calling zoom or pan API methods from inside of <code>beforeZoom</code>, <code>onZoom</code>, <code>beforePan</code> and <code>onPan</code> callbacks may lead to infinite loop.</p></blockquote><p dir="auto"><code>onUpdatedCTM</code> will get called after the CTM will get updated. That happens asynchronously from pan and zoom events.</p><p dir="auto"><code>panEnabled</code> and <code>zoomEnabled</code> are related only to user interaction. If any of this options are disabled - you still can zoom and pan via API.</p><p dir="auto"><code>fit</code> takes precedence over <code>contain</code>. So if you set <code>fit: true</code> then <code>contain</code>'s value doesn't matter.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Embedding remote class="pl-ent">object</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">or you're rendering the SVG after the page loads then you'll have to call svgPanZoom library after your SVG is loaded.</p><p dir="auto">One way to do so is by listening to load event:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<embed type="image/svg+xml" src="/path/to/my/file.svg" id="my-embed"/><script>document.getElementById('my-embed').addEventListener('load', function(){  // Will get called after embed element was loaded  svgPanZoom(document.getElementById('my-embed'));})</script>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">embed</span> <span class="pl-c1">type</span>="<span class="pl-s">image/svg+xml</span>" <span class="pl-c1">src</span>="<span class="pl-s">/path/to/my/file.svg</span>" <span class="pl-c1">id</span>="<span class="pl-s">my-embed</span>"/><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span><span class="pl-kos">></span><span class="pl-smi">document</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">getElementById</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'my-embed'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">addEventListener</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'load'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c">// Will get called after embed element was loaded</span>  <span class="pl-en">svgPanZoom</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-smi">document</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">getElementById</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'my-embed'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Using a custom viewport</h2><a id="user-content-using-a-custom-viewport" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Using a custom viewport" href="#using-a-custom-viewport"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You may want to use a custom viewport if you have more layers in your SVG but you want to <em>pan-zoom</em> only one of them.</p><p dir="auto">By default if:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>There is just one top-level graphical element of type SVGGElement (<code><g></code>)</li><li>SVGGElement has no <code>transform</code> attribute</li><li>There is no other SVGGElement with class name <code>svg-pan-zoom_viewport</code></li></ul><p dir="auto">then the top-level graphical element will be used as viewport.</p><p dir="auto">To specify which layer (SVGGElement) should be <em>pan-zoomed</em> set the <code>svg-pan-zoom_viewport</code> class name to that element:<code><g class="svg-pan-zoom_viewport"></g></code>.</p><blockquote><p dir="auto">Do not set any <em>transform</em> attributes to that element. It will make the library misbehave.If you need <em>transform</em> attribute for viewport better create a nested group element and set <em>transforms</em> to that element:</p></blockquote><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<g class="svg-pan-zoom_viewport">  <g transform="matrix(1,0,0,1,0,0);"></g></g>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">g</span> <span class="pl-c1">class</span>="<span class="pl-s">svg-pan-zoom_viewport</span>"<span class="pl-kos">></span>  <span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">g</span> <span class="pl-c1">transform</span>="<span class="pl-s">matrix(1,0,0,1,0,0);</span>"<span class="pl-kos">></span><span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">g</span><span class="pl-kos">></span><span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">g</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can specify your own viewport selector by altering <code>viewportSelector</code> config value:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="svgPanZoom('#demo-tiger', {  viewportSelector: '.svg-pan-zoom_viewport'});// orvar viewportGroupElement = class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'#demo-tiger'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">viewportSelector</span>: <span class="pl-s">'.svg-pan-zoom_viewport'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-c">// or</span><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">viewportGroupElement</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">document</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">getElementById</span><span bumbu/svg-pan-zoom</code></li><li>Require <em>svg-pan-zoom</em> in your source file <code>svgPanZoom = require('svg-pan-zoom')</code></li><li>Use in the same way as you would do with global svgPanZoom: <code>instance = svgPanZoom('#demo-tiger')</code></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Use with Require.js (or other AMD class="heading-element" dir="auto">Custom events support</h2><a id="user-content-custom-events-support" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Custom events support" href="#custom-events-support"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 pinch).</p><p dir="auto">It is possible by setting <code>customEventsHandler</code> configuration option.<code>customEventsHandler</code> should be an object with following attributes:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>haltEventListeners</code>: array of strings</li><li><code>init</code>: function</li><li><code>destroy</code>: function</li></ul><p dir="auto"><code>haltEventListeners</code> specifies which default event listeners should be disabled (in order to avoid conflicts as svg-pan-zoom by default supports panning using touch events).</p><p dir="auto"><code>init</code> is a function that is called when svg-pan-zoom is initialized. An object is passed into this function.Passed object has following attributes:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>svgElement</code> - SVGSVGElement</li><li><code>instance</code> - svg-pan-zoom public API instance</li></ul><p dir="auto"><code>destroy</code> is a function called upon svg-pan-zoom destroy</p><p dir="auto">An example of how to use it together with <a href="http://hammerjs.github.io" rel="nofollow">Hammer.js</a>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var options = {  zoomEnabled: true, controlIconsEnabled: true, customEventsHandler: {    // Halt all touch events    haltEventListeners: ['touchstart', 'touchend', 'touchmove', 'touchleave', 'touchcancel']    // Init custom events handler  , init: function(options) {      // Init Hammer      this.hammer = Hammer(options.svgElement)      // Handle double tap      this.hammer.on('doubletap', function(ev){        options.instance.zoomIn()      })    }    // Destroy custom events handler  , destroy: function(){      this.hammer.destroy()    }  }}svgPanZoom('#mobile-svg', options);"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c">// Halt all touch events</span>    <span class="pl-c1">haltEventListeners</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'touchstart'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>    <span class="pl-c">// Destroy custom events handler</span>  <span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">destroy</span>: <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Keep content visible/Limit pan</h2><a id="user-content-keep-content-visiblelimit-pan" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Keep content visible/Limit pan" href="#keep-content-visiblelimit-pan"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 want to keep SVG content visible by not allowing panning over SVG borders.</p><p dir="auto">To do so you may prevent or alter panning from <code>beforePan</code> callback. For more details take a look at <code>demo/limit-pan.html</code> example.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Public API</h2><a aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 call <code>svgPanZoom</code> method it returns an object with following methods:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>enablePan</li><li>disablePan</li><li>isPanEnabled</li><li>pan</li><li>panBy</li><li>getPan</li><li>setBeforePan</li><li>setOnPan</li><li>enableZoom</li><li>disableZoom</li><li>isZoomEnabled</li><li>enableControlIcons</li><li>disableControlIcons</li><li>isControlIconsEnabled</li><li>enableDblClickZoom</li><li>disableDblClickZoom</li><li>isDblClickZoomEnabled</li><li>enableMouseWheelZoom</li><li>disableMouseWheelZoom</li><li>isMouseWheelZoomEnabled</li><li>setZoomScaleSensitivity</li><li>setMinZoom</li><li>setMaxZoom</li><li>setBeforeZoom</li><li>setOnZoom</li><li>zoom</li><li>zoomBy</li><li>zoomAtPoint</li><li>zoomAtPointBy</li><li>zoomIn</li><li>zoomOut</li><li>setOnUpdatedCTM</li><li>getZoom</li><li>resetZoom</li><li>resetPan</li><li>reset</li><li>fit</li><li>contain</li><li>center</li><li>updateBBox</li><li>resize</li><li>getSizes</li><li>destroy</li></ul><p dir="auto">To programmatically pan, call the pan method with vector as first argument:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// Get instancevar panZoomTiger = svgPanZoom('#demo-tiger');// Pan to rendered point x = 50, y = 50panZoomTiger.pan({x: 50, y: 50})// Pan by x = 50, y = 50 of id="user-content-svg-height-is-broken" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: SVG height is broken" href="#svg-height-is-broken"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Because the library removes <code>viewBox</code> attribute from the SVG element - you may experience that the height of your SVG changed (usually to 150px). In order to fix that you have to add height to the <code>SVG</code> or <code>object</code>/<code>embed</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Calling library methods throw errors when SVG is hidden</h3><a id="user-content-calling-library-methods-throw-errors-when-svg-is-hidden" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Calling library methods throw errors when SVG is hidden" href="#calling-library-methods-throw-errors-when-svg-is-hidden"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This library does not support working with SVGs that are hidden as some browsers detach child documents from the DOM when those are hidden. See <a href="https://github.com/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/279" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/279/hovercard">#279</a> for more details.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Performance issues on initialization</h3><a id="user-content-performance-issues-on-initialization" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Performance issues on initialization" href="#performance-issues-on-initialization"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If performance is bad only on initialization of the library, then consider wrapping all SVG's child elements into a <code><g></code> beforehand. This way the library will not have to create it and move all children into it (which is the root cause of the issue). See <a href="https://github.com/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/146#issuecomment-137873358" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/146/hovercard">#146 comment</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Performance issues while panning/zooming</h3><a id="user-content-performance-issues-while-panningzooming" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Performance issues while panning/zooming" href="#performance-issues-while-panningzooming"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Most often those are caused by big SVG files. And in those cases it's browsers not being able to handle those SVGs fast enough.See <a href="https://github.com/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/277" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/bumbu/svg-pan-zoom/issues/277/hovercard">#277</a> for more details.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How to limit
